meanings.definition: A large hose used to extinguish fires.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter grabbed the firehose to put out the blazing building.
meanings.sent2: The fire department always carries a firehose on their truck for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: When the firehose sneezed, water sprayed everywhere!
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed out like a firehose, drenching everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The firehose's powerful stream could reach even the highest flames.

meanings.definition: To spray or douse with a firehose.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter had to firehose the burning car to save the trapped cat.
meanings.sent2: They decided to firehose the garden to water all the plants quickly.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally firehosed his friend while trying to clean the driveway.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain firehosed the streets, causing flooding in the city.
meanings.sent5: She firehosed the canvas with paint, creating a beautiful abstract artwork.
